verbs.description: incapacitate (third-person singular simple present incapacitates, present participle incapacitating, simple past and past participle incapacitated) (transitive)

entries.meaning: To make someone or something incapable of doing something; to disable.
examples: The police officer was incapacitated by a blow to the head.

entries.meaning: (law) To make someone ineligible; to disqualify.
